thread.title: Former Manchester United striker Dwight Yorke 'denied entry into USA'
thread.title_full: Former Manchester United striker Dwight Yorke 'denied entry into USA'

author: Simon Coyle
title: Former Manchester United striker Dwight Yorke 'denied entry into USA'
text:
Former Manchester United striker Dwight Yorke 'denied entry into USA' TV presenter Richard Keys says the 45-year-old was denied entry into the the USA on Friday morning Share Get   
Former Manchester United striker Dwight Yorke has reportedly been denied entry into the United States due to having an Iranian stamp in his passport. 
Sports presenter Richard Keys made the claim on Twitter after Yorke had appeared as a pundit on beIN Sports on Thursday night for United's game against St Etienne. 
Yorke, 45, is believed to have been travelling to Miami. 
On Friday morning Keys, who is a presenter on beIn Sports, tweeted out "Well done @realDonaldTrump. Man U ambassador Dwight Yorke denied transit access to Miami cause he has Iranian stamp in passport. #crazy". Read More 
Earlier this month US President Donald Trump introduced a controversial 'travel ban' which banned refugees and nationals from seven majority-Muslim countries: Iraq, Syria, Iran, Libya, Somalia, Sudan, and Yemen. 
The ban has since been overturned but Yorke was still stopped according to Keys. 
Yorke spent four years at Manchester United, where he made 147 appearances, scoring 65 times. Like us on Facebook
